word.definition: the thing that sb plans or wants to do
word.example: Our main aim is to increase sales.

word.definition: the time off work that sb is allowed each year
word.example: We get twenty days’ annual leave.

word.definition: the season of the year after summer, when leaves fall from the trees
word.example: The fruits are ready to pick in autumn.

word.definition: a time when there is a lot of activity because a lot of people want to do sth, buy sth etc.
word.example: We take on extra staff during busy periods.

word.definition: a computer record that contains a lot of organized information
word.example: We keep a database of all our customers’ names, addresses, and past orders.

word.definition: a point in time by which sth must be done
word.example:
The deadline for applications is
30 April.

word.definition: a thing that happens, especially an important planned occasion
word.example: His 50th birthday is going to be a very special event.

word.definition: to believe that sth will happen based on what you know
word.example: I expect he will arrive about 9.30.

word.definition: an event at which a new product is made available for the first time
word.example: The publishers held a big book launch for his first novel.

word.definition: a weekend that includes an extra day or two of holiday on Friday or Monday
word.example: We’re planning a long weekend in Amsterdam.

word.definition: materials used to wrap or protect a product when it is sold
word.example: Attractive packaging can help sell your product.

word.definition: to say what will happen based on what you know
word.example: It’s difficult to predict who will win the election.

word.definition: a day when most shops, businesses and schools close
word.example: They created a public holiday in his honour.

word.definition: a time when there is not much activity because not many people want to do sth, buy sth etc.
word.example: I catch up with my paperwork during quiet periods in the shop.

word.definition: basic materials that are used to make a profit
word.example: One of our biggest costs is raw materials.

word.definition: a letter or note asking sb to remember to do sth
word.example: If you do not pay within 14 days, we will send a reminder.

word.definition: a plan of the work you need to do and when you need to do it
word.example: I have a very full schedule this week.

word.definition: a flat board fixed to the wall or as part of a cupboard, to put things on
word.example: The top shelf was too high for customers to reach.

word.definition: to send goods to sb
word.example: The company ships its products all over the world.

word.definition: the season of the year after winter, when plants and flowers start to grow again
word.example: I love Paris in the spring.

word.definition: to make a short statement giving the main points of sth
word.example: The results are summarized at the end of this document.

word.definition: the season of the year after spring, when it is hottest and people often have their main holiday
word.example: They often spend the summer by the sea.

word.definition: a date by which sth must be done that does not allow you much time to complete it
word.example: We are working to a very tight deadline.

word.definition: time when you do not have to be at work
word.example: He took some time off to visit his sick mother.

word.definition: a list which shows when particular events will happen
word.example: Here’s a timetable for the training session.

word.definition: to add the most recent information to sth
word.example: Our website is updated every day.

word.definition: the season of the year after autumn, when it is coldest and the days are shortest
word.example: We usually go skiing every winter.
